str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Already; now at length, now after all this waiting. Apparently from e and de; even now.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To die, be dying, be dead. A strengthened form of a simpler primary thano than'-o; to die.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To break down (in pieces), crush, break into. From kata and the base of rhegnumi; to rend in pieces, i.e. Crack apart.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The leg (from the hip downwards). Apparently from skello; the leg.
